benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/bundles/{bundleId}/tags - Add tags to bundle

covered: Valid Payload scenarios covered: TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04, TC05, TC07, TC08 (invalid bundleId), TC09 (non-existent bundleId) scenarios for valid creation paths; TC10, TC11, TC12 cover malformed/misformatted payloads and invalid tag definitions; TC13, TC14, TC15 cover missing header, missing body, and extra parameters; TC16 covers unauthorized access; TC17 covers service unavailable; TC18 covers injection/malicious payload; TC19 recovery from transient failures; TC20/TC21 test payload size limits; TC22 timeout scenarios; TC23 extra headers case; TC24/TC25 performance under load; TC26 regression for duplicates; TC27/TC28 integration checks; TC29 accessibility documentation test.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large datasets (not always applicable to tag creation, but a potential extension when listing or validating many tags).
Caching Behavior: No tests verify caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) for tag-related responses.
Rate Limiting: No tests to verify behavior under rapid repeated POST requests or throttling behavior.
Server Error Handling beyond 503: No explicit test for 500 Internal Server Error condtions (e.g., unexpected DB failure in detail).
Authorization edge cases beyond missing/invalid token (e.g., token refresh flow or scope-based access control).
recommendations: Add tests for pagination-related GET operations if/when GET /bundles/{bundleId}/tags supports pagination; ensure consistency when listing many tags post-creation.
Introduce tests validating caching headers on responses (ETag/Cache-Control) for GET after POST or 304 handling if implemented.
Add rate-limiting/throttling tests to ensure system handles bursts of POST requests gracefully.
Add a 500 Internal Server Error scenario to simulate unexpected backend/database failures during tag creation, to cover server error handling beyond 503.
Expand authorization coverage to include more nuanced scopes or token refresh flows if your security model supports them.
